item.title: Microsoft says attackers use exposed ASP.NET keys to deploy malware
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft warns that attackers are deploying malware in ViewState code injection attacks using static ASP. NET machine keys found online. [...]

item.title: Kimsuky hackers use new custom RDP Wrapper for remote access
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The North Korean hacking group known as Kimsuky was observed in recent attacks using a custom-built RDP Wrapper and proxy tools to directly access infected machines. [...]

item.title: Critical RCE bug in Microsoft Outlook now exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA warned U.S. federal agencies on Thursday to secure their systems against ongoing attacks targeting a critical Microsoft Outlook remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability. [...]

item.title: Hackers exploit SimpleHelp RMM flaws to deploy Sliver malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are targeting vulnerable SimpleHelp RMM clients to create administrator accounts, drop backdoors, and potentially lay the groundwork for ransomware attacks. [...]

item.title: Critical Cisco ISE bug can let attackers run commands as root
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cisco has fixed two critical Identity Services Engine (ISE) vulnerabilities that can let attackers with read-only admin privileges bypass authorization and run commands as root. [...]

item.title: DDoS attacks reportedly behind DayZ and Arma network outages
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An ongoing distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack targets Bohemia Interactive's infrastructure, preventing players of DayZ and Arma Reforger from playing the games online. [...]

item.title: British engineering firm IMI discloses breach, shares no details
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: British-based engineering firm IMI plc has disclosed a security breach after unknown attackers hacked into the company's systems. [...]

item.title: New Microsoft script updates Windows media with bootkit malware fixes
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released a PowerShell script to help Windows users and admins update bootable media so it utilizes the new "Windows UEFI CA 2023" certificate before the mitigations of the BlackLotus UEFI bootkit are enforced later this year. [...]

item.title: Robocallers posing as FCC fraud prevention team call FCC staff
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FCC has proposed a $4,492,500 fine against VoIP service provider Telnyx for allegedly allowing customers to make robocalls posing as fictitious FCC "Fraud Prevention Team," by failing to comply with Know Your Customer (KYC) rules. However, Telnyx says the FCC is mistaken and denies the accusations. [...]

item.title: Ransomware payments fell by 35% in 2024, totalling $813,550,000
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Payments to ransomware actors decreased 35% year-over-year in 2024, totaling $813.55 million, down from $1.25 billion recorded in 2023. [...]

item.title: CISA orders agencies to patch Linux kernel bug exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​CISA has ordered federal agencies to secure their systems within three weeks against a high-severity Linux kernel flaw actively exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: Hackers spoof Microsoft ADFS login pages to steal credentials
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A help desk phishing campaign targets an organization's Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) using spoofed login pages to steal credentials and bypass multi-factor authentication (MFA) protections. [...]
